str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Most of all, especially. Neuter plural of the superlative of an apparently primary adverb mala; most or particularly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural

str2: The act of pollution, defilement. From miaino; contamination.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.
Behind, after; back, backwards. From the same as opisthen with enclitic of direction; to the back, i.e. Aback.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To despise, scorn, and show it by active insult, disregard. From kata and phroneo; to think against, i.e. Disesteem.
A daring, bold man. From tolmao; a daring man.
Self-satisfied, arrogant, stubborn. From autos and the base of hedone; self-pleasing, i.e. Arrogant.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To tremble, be afraid. Strengthened from a primary treo; to 'tremble' or fear.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From blasphemos; to vilify; specially, to speak impiously.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
